summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from December 2020, forwarding a discussion from December 2019. The emails discuss the status of the investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell, concerns about an upcoming ABC News special on Jeffrey Epstein, and coordination regarding the timing of potential arrests to maintain credibility with victims.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Discussed as the target of a potential arrest by SDNY; the FBI agents are coordinating on the timing of her arrest in relation to a planned ABC News special report.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Deceased financier and accused sex trafficker
persons.context: Mentioned as the subject of an upcoming ABC News special report, which is influencing the FBI's coordination on the Maxwell investigation.

persons.name: Amy Robach
persons.context: Named in the URL for a Variety article about ABC News planning special reports on Jeffrey Epstein.

connections.description: Maxwell is discussed in the context of the Epstein investigation, with the FBI coordinating her potential arrest following Epstein's death and media coverage.

events.title: FBI discussion on Maxwell investigation status
events.description: Internal FBI emails discuss the status of the Ghislaine Maxwell investigation, noting an interview with a cooperator in California did not go well and questioning where the case stands.

events.title: Scheduled ABC News special on Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: An ABC News special report on Jeffrey Epstein, featuring Amy Robach, was scheduled to air. FBI agents express concern that arrests (presumably of Maxwell) should happen before this broadcast to maintain credibility with victims.

events.title: FBI coordination on arrest timing
events.description: An FBI agent emails colleagues, noting the upcoming ABC News special and urging that arrests (likely of Ghislaine Maxwell) by SDNY should occur before the story airs to avoid the appearance of reacting to media pressure.

keyFacts: FBI agents were actively discussing the timing of Ghislaine Maxwell's arrest in late 2019, specifically in relation to a scheduled ABC News special report on Jeffrey Epstein.
An interview with a cooperator in California regarding the Maxwell investigation was reported to have 'not gone very well' as of December 31, 2019.

FBI personnel expressed concern that if arrests happened after the ABC News special aired, it would appear the Department of Justice was merely reacting to media pressure, potentially damaging credibility with victims.
The email chain shows internal FBI coordination and strategic planning between New York field office agents and possibly SDNY prosecutors regarding the Maxwell case.
